page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: This block is an orderly patchwork of gently sloping fields, hedgerows and small woodlands situated between {Nuneaton (Warks) and Hinckley (Leics). The land is mainly farmed, and at its highest elevation lies the village of{Higham-on-the-Hill,}the birthplace of a former{Archbishop of Canterbury,} the{Rev. Geoffrey Francis Fisher,}who died in 1972. This area has become more generally known since the development of The {Motor Industry Research Association {(MIRA),}which is situated on the north side of{The Watling Street}- now the A5, a major artery in the present-day trunk road system. The large Country Houses bordering this section of the A5 have been adapted for communal, business or hospital use.{The Ashby Canal}cuts through the block's eastern boundary.
